CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Operations Staff relative to Management Team?
SRP.A: Operations Staff is {above} Management Team in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Human Resources relative to Management Team?
SRP.A: Human Resources is {below} Management Team in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Management Team relative to Operations Staff?
SRP.A: Management Team is {below} Operations Staff in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total absenteeism rate?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Research & Development}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total absenteeism rate?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Operations Staff}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Operations Staff's minimum Absenteeism Rate in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Operations Staff's minimum Absenteeism Rate is in {2006}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Sales Team's maximum Absenteeism Rate in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Sales Team's maximum Absenteeism Rate is in {2013}.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2007, did the total Absenteeism Rate experience a larger or smaller change than between 2003 and 2006?
NC.A: The change in total absenteeism rate between 1997 and 2007 was {larger} than between 2003 and 2006.

NC.Q: Was the total Absenteeism Rate in 1989 higher or lower than in 2001?
NC.A: The total absenteeism rate in 1989 was {lower} than in 2001.

NC.Q: Was the total Absenteeism Rate in 2001 higher or lower than in 2008?
NC.A: The total absenteeism rate in 2001 was {lower} than in 2008.

NC.Q: Between 1998 and 2003, was the average total Absenteeism Rate higher or lower than between 1997 and 2007?
NC.A: The average total absenteeism rate between 1998 and 2003 was {lower} than between 1997 and 2007.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Human Resources} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Operations Staff and Human Resources first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Operations Staff and Human Resources first exchanged leading positions in {1990}.
